In this project, a test case is defined as a one-dimensional, fixed-size array of integers. The goal of the algorithm is to sort this array (either in-place or out-of-place; the key is that the sorted elements are written back into the same input array at the end). For Java programs, the test case is declared as:

int[] arrayToSort = new int[n];

where n is the size of an array to be sorted.
